greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fully multiplicative with a(prime(m)) = prime(k) when m = prime(k), and a(prime(m)) = 1 when m is not a prime.
comment: The number of applications to reach 1 is A322027(n). Positions of first appearances are A076610. - _Gus Wiseman_, Jan 17 2020
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
formula: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, if A055396(n) is a prime, then a(n) = A055396(n) * a(A032742(n)), otherwise a(n) = a(A032742(n)).
example: For n = 360 = 2^3 * 3^2 * 5 = prime(1)^3 * prime(2)^2 * prime(3), 1 is not a prime, but 2 and 3 are, thus a(360) = 2^2 * 3 = 12.
xref: Primes of prime index are A006450.
Primes of nonprime index are A007821.
Products of primes of prime index are A076610.
Products of primes of nonprime index are A320628.
The number of prime prime indices is A257994.
The number of nonprime prime indices is A330944.
Numbers whose prime indices are not all prime are A330945.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 26 2017
